Author: icky
Content: If you do want to play with free tools, try haXe and swfmill.

Author: icky
Content: I don't believe he was ever a COBOL expert, since COBOL is basically stripped-down English with the added requirements of syntax, logic, and correct spelling.

Author: corentin
Content:
I've noticed that, over time, programmers (including myself) tend to break some punctuation rules. I guess it's because we don't write:

char *foo = "bar;"

Author: corentin
Content: It's just that people have a different opinion of what good style is (a lot of people love Comic Sans MS and websites with animated, blinking stuff).

Author: eru
Content:
Well said.

Reminds me of the broken window fallacy (http://jim.com/econ/chap02p1.html).
